2 minutes ago, 1990eam said:

Hello Galileo. Thanks for mantaining the awesome mods as always.

I think I'm getting too many clouds after I install SVE. Like nowhere close to what pictures in this thread look like. Is this normal? I'm back after a long break with KSP and I don't remember if this was the usual behavior.

No SVE:



SVE:

 

Modlist:

Well, you have AVP installed with SVE.... what do you expect?

@1990eamWhy do you have Astronomers AND SVE? Because both do the same so you must delete one of them.

Also Kopernicus needs ModularFlightIntegrator which is included in the Kopernicus-Download. You don`t have it.

Edited April 15, 2018 by Cheesecake

When I install SVE kerbins scatterer atmosphere config is set to something called 'urlum'. I'm sorry for asking for help but I searched the thread for 'urlum' and google for 'ksp sve urlum', and can't find help.

 

How do i change it to kerbin? It won't let me edit the field. Should I just delete the urlum config? I've tried reinstalling scatterer, SVE, and dependencies.

 

I don't have the outer planets mod that urlum seems to be a part of. I do have SVE, SVT, scatterer, eve, distant objects, planetshine. I'm guessing it's some sort of mod conflict so if anyone sees one here I'd appreciate your help.

All mods are updated as of a week ago.

50 minutes ago, Duhya said:

When I install SVE kerbins scatterer atmosphere config is set to something called 'urlum'. I'm sorry for asking for help but I searched the thread for 'urlum' and google for 'ksp sve urlum', and can't find help.

 

How do i change it to kerbin? It won't let me edit the field. Should I just delete the urlum config? I've tried reinstalling scatterer, SVE, and dependencies.

 

I don't have the outer planets mod that urlum seems to be a part of. I do have SVE, SVT, scatterer, eve, distant objects, planetshine. I'm guessing it's some sort of mod conflict so if anyone sees one here I'd appreciate your help.

All mods are updated as of a week ago.

That’s an issue with scatterer and module manager. If you don’t make changes, it doesn’t effect anything. 

Why are you trying to change things anyway? Firstly, the cfgs are set up in a particular way and if you make changes, it will cause issues throughout the mod as the dependencies do not play nice with with Module Manager. Secondly, I do not provide support to altered versions of SVE. I just don’t have the time for it. So if you are determined to make changes, you are on your own.

Edited April 16, 2018 by Galileo

57 minutes ago, Galileo said:

That’s an issue with scatterer and module manager. If you don’t make changes, it doesn’t effect anything. 

Why are you trying to change things anyway? Firstly, the cfgs are set up in a particular way and if you make changes, it will cause issues throughout the mod as the dependencies do not play nice with with Module Manager. Secondly, I do not provide support to altered versions of SVE. I just don’t have the time for it. So if you are determined to make changes, you are on your own.

 

So the discrepancy isn't an issue.

The reason i'm even looking at these settings is because scatterer post processing is off by default when i start the game for some reason. The change i make is i click 'toggle post processing,' but i thought this discrepancy might be somehow related, so i set out to fix it since it's the only lead i had.

I ended up fixing post processing not defaulting to on by deleting SVE and scatterer, reinstalling scatterer, booting the game, and finally reinstalling SVE. Thanks for the help.

7 hours ago, Duhya said:

 

So the discrepancy isn't an issue.

The reason i'm even looking at these settings is because scatterer post processing is off by default when i start the game for some reason. The change i make is i click 'toggle post processing,' but i thought this discrepancy might be somehow related, so i set out to fix it since it's the only lead i had.

I ended up fixing post processing not defaulting to on by deleting SVE and scatterer, reinstalling scatterer, booting the game, and finally reinstalling SVE. Thanks for the help.

SVE is probably disabling/overriding some scatterer settings on startup (on purpose). That's why they won't save/stay-on when you quit and restart the game.

25 minutes ago, Beetlecat said:

SVE is probably disabling/overriding some scatterer settings on startup (on purpose). That's why they won't save/stay-on when you quit and restart the game. 

Yes, SVE disables or changes a few settings that 95% of ppl don’t notice anyway and it saves performance by a ton. I don’t have time to deal with “my performance is crap” posts, so I nipped it in the bud.

just recently people have come to notice that SVE performs better than default EVE + Scatterer, so I’d say it has been justified.

Edited April 16, 2018 by Galileo

56 minutes ago, Beetlecat said:

SVE is probably disabling/overriding some scatterer settings on startup (on purpose). That's why they won't save/stay-on when you quit and restart the game. 

I think i'm confusing people. The whole of post processing was off by default. Meaning scatterer was doing nothing, and was effectively off, leaving the game looking like vanilla. I've fixed it since.

 

Unless scatterer is supposed to do nothing by default, I don't think i've changed any settings from default by clicking the 'toggle post processing' button.
Hey, guys. Is there still a node I can copy to get cirrus clouds over Duna?

1 hour ago, Pthigrivi said:

Hey, guys. Is there still a node I can copy to get cirrus clouds over Duna?

No I don’t have clouds on Duna, but I’m not opposed to adding some next update.

Awesome! And also, randomly, I learned something:

https://m.phys.org/news/2017-03-curiosity-captures-gravity-clouds-mars.html

7 hours ago, Galileo said:

No I don’t have clouds on Duna, but I’m not opposed to adding some next update.

Some high, white cirrus would be awesome; those big polar ice caps have to sublimate that moisture somewhere.  

I had added some a few weeks back but I was never really happy with how they turned out. Mostly I couldn't find a good cloud texture to use. This one was okay but about twice as dense as I was going for. And it only looked like this in Map view from the Tracking Station. The rest of the time it seemed over-exposed, like the air was glowing. 

I couldn't quite figure out how to reconcile these so just went back to the "standard" SVE configs.

2 hours ago, LameLefty said:

Some high, white cirrus would be awesome; those big polar ice caps have to sublimate that moisture somewhere.  

I had added some a few weeks back but I was never really happy with how they turned out. Mostly I couldn't find a good cloud texture to use. This one was okay but about twice as dense as I was going for. And it only looked like this in Map view from the Tracking Station. The rest of the time it seemed over-exposed, like the air was glowing. 

I couldn't quite figure out how to reconcile these so just went back to the "standard" SVE configs. 

I figured out the exposure issue, and the culprit was KSP itself. The stock lighting exposure on a scale of 0-1 is set at 0.9. With Kopernicus, I am able to lower the value and make it look as intended. So I will be including a cfg to fix that, and the next version of SVE will come with a high recommendation for Kopernicus (I assume most people download it anyway for Jool rings or OPM, so it’s practically a dependency anyway)
Stunning work! It's absolutely beautiful.

<redirecting to another thread>

Edited April 29, 2018 by ksp_colin

is there an option to get the HD kerbin textures without the clouds and all the rest? was trying to layout a waypoint path for a mechjeb rover to follow but it kept getting caught on some fairly steep slopes that just don't appear on the fuzzy stock map.

Are you running Scatterer?  If so, how recent is your version?  I believe this was a known issue in Scatterer for a while until recently, when it was fixed.  Make sure you have up to date versions.
